citances.sentence: 56 Barely a week later, the defendant sought leave to appeal by way of notice of motion against Moore J's decision on the question of costs. In April 2009 Jagot J ( Croker v Commissioner of Taxation [2009] FCA 353) refused leave to appeal concurring with the approach taken by Moore J as to costs, stating at [16] "[t]his is a case where the proceeding should never have been brought".
